mil7.3.1:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil7.3.1:0.2_0: The account of the fault-finding mind
mil7.3.1:1.2_0: “After the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in a bundle of grass, wood, or water.
mil7.3.1:1.3_0: In the same way, great king, by means of perfection, while you find sapwood, you should apply yourself to perfection and see perfection.
mil7.3.1:1.4_0: Being agreed with a single warm, great king, that’s how to cross.
mil7.3.1:1.5_0: When you’ve spoken like this, great king, you won’t honor the senior monks,
mil7.3.1:2.1_0: ‘A large family of rice called “g sweet”,
mil7.3.1:2.3_0: I drunk the boiled with clothes,
mil7.3.1:3.1_0: So too, when the Buddha went of
mil7.3.1:3.3_0: I shall hold on the Suppiyā and fast
mil7.3.1:4.1_0: The first part of a finger-snap.
